intro: Hibbertia limosa, commonly known as the slender hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal heathland and sandplain areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the branches. Hibbertia limosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant and long-lasting blooms.
